definition: leap year/(lunar calendar) year with a thirteen intercalary month
intercalary/an extra day or month inserted into the lunar or solar calendar (such as February 29)

sentences.english: Then, he borrowed the idea of a seven-day week and leap year from the Hebrew calendar.
sentences.chinese: 接着，他借用了希伯來曆法中一週七天和閏年的概念。

sentences.english: And twenty-nine on each Leap Year.
sentences.chinese: 每個閏年二月有二十九天。

sentences.english: Leap-year proposals are an old folklore tradition that dates back to the 5th century.
sentences.chinese: 閏年求婚是個古老的民俗傳統能追溯到五世紀。

sentences.english: They celebrate their birthdays on February 28th or March 1st during non-leap years.
sentences.chinese: 非閏年時，他們會在二月二十八日或三月一日慶生。

sentences.english: Why do we have a leap year?
But according Chinese Traditional Calendar, Every 19-year have seven-leap month.
sentences.chinese: 但依照中國傳統曆法，每十九年有七個閏年。

sentences.english: Don't forget about the adjustment for leap years when using this trick.
sentences.chinese: 使用這一技巧時不要忘記對閏年做出調整。

sentences.english: The two most people encounter are leap year and daylight savings time.
sentences.chinese: 人們最常遇到的兩種情況是閏年和夏令時。

definition: (math.) the ratio of the circumference of a circle to its diameter (π)
student who also works part-time/(old) reform-school student
